dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependent_to.description:
ecKit is a cross-platform c++ toolkit that supports development of tools
and applications at ECMWF.
dependent_to.name: eckit

dependent_to.description:
Es is an extensible shell. The language was derived from the Plan 9
shell, rc, and was influenced by functional programming languages, such
as Scheme, and the Tcl embeddable programming language. This
implementation is derived from Byron Rakitzis's public domain
implementation of rc.
dependent_to.name: es-shell

dependent_to.description: Linux PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules for Linux) project.
dependent_to.name: linux-pam

dependent_to.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
dependent_to.name: swig

dependent_to.description:
Tmux is a terminal multiplexer. What is a terminal multiplexer? It lets
you switch easily between several programs in one terminal, detach them
(they keep running in the background) and reattach them to a different
terminal. And do a lot more.
dependent_to.name: tmux

description:
Berkeley Yacc is an LALR(1) parser generator. Berkeley Yacc has been
made as compatible as possible with AT&T Yacc. Berkeley Yacc can accept
any input specification that conforms to the AT&T Yacc documentation.
Specifications that take advantage of undocumented features of AT&T Yacc
will probably be rejected.
name: byacc

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
